page.title: 18CHELTENHAM ARCHITECTURE
page.content:
{ {REGENCY}STYLES. During the Regency period, when it was fashionable to take the waters (following Royal example) many fine terraces were built. Prime examples of these still remain. e.g. Landsdown Crescent, Royal Well Crescent, the Pittville area, Imperial Gardens and Montpellier. All are now used as business premises or flats. None, regrettably, remain the private residence of one family. There exists a local Society which encourages the preservation of Regency houses by contributing towards the high cost of repairs.
A recent development in Montpellier has been the construction of a shopping complex which attempts to blend Regency and present day architectural styles.
